+
'''''Rabbit of Seville''''' is a [[1949]] [[Warner Bros.]] ''[[Looney Tunes]]'' theatrical [[Animated cartoon|cartoon]] short released in [[1950]]. It was directed by [[Chuck Jones]] and written by [[Michael Maltese]].
The cartoon, in a plotline reminiscent of ''[[Stage Door Cartoon]]'', features [[Bugs Bunny]] being chased by [[Elmer Fudd]] into the stage door of the [[Hollywood Bowl]], whereupon Bugs tricks Elmer into going onstage, and participating in a break-neck operatic production of their chase punctuated with gags and accompanied by musical arrangements by [[Carl Stalling]], focusing on [[Rossini| Rossini's]] overture to ''[[The Barber of Seville]]''.
The cartoon, in a plotline reminiscent of ''[[Stage Door Cartoon]]'', features [[Bugs Bunny]] being chased by [[Elmer Fudd]] into the stage door of the [[Hollywood Bowl]], whereupon Bugs tricks Elmer into going onstage, and participating in a break-neck operatic production of their chase punctuated with gags and accompanied by musical arrangements by [[Carl Stalling]], focusing on [[Rossini| Rossini's]] overture to ''[[The Barber of Seville]]''.
